item.title: Covid: Pfizer and AstraZeneca jabs effective against Indian variant - study
item.description: They are effective against symptomatic disease but protection is low after only one dose, a study says.

item.title: Glastonbury: Emily Eavis says she is 'so sorry' after technical issues derail live-stream
item.description: After thousands are locked out of the virtual concert, organisers make it freely available online.

item.title: Diana interview: Lord Hall resigns from National Gallery
item.description: The ex-BBC director general says continuing as National Gallery chairman would be a "distraction".

item.title: Israel-Palestinian conflict: Eyes on peace options as Gaza truce holds
item.description: Mediators try to cement the truce, as Israel and Palestinian militants take stock of an 11-day conflict.

item.title: Mount Nyiragongo: DR Congo plans to evacuate city as volcano erupts
item.description: Residents of Goma flee to safety as nearby Mount Nyiragongo throws huge lava fountains into the air.

item.title: Princess Latifa: Dubai photo appears to show missing woman
item.description: The Emirati princess has been imprisoned in Dubai since she tried to escape in 2018.

item.title: Virgin Galactic rocket plane flies to edge of space
item.description: Sir Richard Branson's spaceplane completes the first of three key test flights above New Mexico.

item.title: Prince William: Scotland holds my happiest and saddest memories
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge says his connection with the country "will forever run deep" in a speech.

item.title: Myanmar coup: Junta head claims Aung San Suu Kyi 'in good health'
item.description: Min Aung Hlaing makes the claim in his first interview since seizing power in February.

item.title: Mayhill: Four arrests after Swansea disorder
item.description: Three men and a 16-year-old boy have been arrested on suspicion of unlawful violence.

item.title: Covid: India tells social media firms to remove 'India variant' from content
item.description: Platforms are told to take down all content that refers to an "Indian variant" of the coronavirus.

item.title: Covid vaccination certificates hit by security glitch
item.description: The flaw could allow people to edit personal details on vaccination status certificates after downloading them.

item.title: HMS Queen Elizabeth: The Queen tours Royal Navy flagship
item.description: The Queen has been visiting the Royal Navy flagship, HMS Queen Elizabeth, in Portsmouth.

item.title: China's Zhurong rover takes first drive on Mars
item.description: China is now the second country after the US to operate a rover on the Red Planet.

item.title: Five decades of Eurovision songs... from memory
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg returns to delight you with his piano renditions and encyclopaedic knowledge of the Eurovision Song Contest.

item.title: Week in pictures: 15 - 21 May 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Covid: Out in Brighton on the first Friday night after rules ease
item.description: "Life is meant for living and we are living it," says one woman, as people enjoy indoor pubs and restaurants.

item.title: Over 3,000 fans will attend the final of this year's Eurovision Song Contest
item.description: After being cancelled and replaced by an online 'event' last year, the competition is back on and welcoming over 3,000 fans to the live show.

item.title: Amazon in pictures: Sebastião Salgado's last frontier
item.description: Photographer Sebastião Salgado captured images of the Amazon's forest, rivers, and tribes.

item.title: Water so toxic 'it could burn your eyes'
item.description: Martin Patience gets to the source of Lebanon's water crisis.

item.title: Covid Vaccines: Could they be magnetic?
item.description: Videos of people sticking magnets to their arms where they claim they’ve had the Covid vaccine have gone viral. We debunk this so-called magnet challenge.

item.title: Friends reunion to air in UK and Ireland on Sky
item.description: The long-awaited follow-up to the popular US sitcom will feature all six of its original stars.

item.title: George Floyd death: How US police are trying to win back trust
item.description: A year after George Floyd's death, it's not just civilians who'll be reflecting on what happened.

item.title: The 10-year-old boy who beat a chess grandmaster - but didn't want to boast
item.description: Frederick Waldhausen Gordon is just 10 years old and has already defeated a chess grandmaster.

item.title: 'A meme that almost made me quit my family WhatsApp group'
item.description: Some Indians are sharing dark humour memes inspired by the pandemic - and occasionally offending cousins in the diaspora.

item.title: George Best: How Man Utd legend left for Dunstable Town
item.description: George Best was still only 28. A mercurial genius when on song for Manchester United, his next move was to Dunstable Town.

item.title: Myanmar: The small embattled town that stood up to the army
item.description: Mindat put up tenacious resistance to the Burmese army but is now in desperate need of help.

item.title: Timeline: Martin Bashir's actions from Diana interview to Dyson report
item.description: An inquiry into Martin Bashir’s interview with Princess Diana in 1995 concludes that he acted in a “deceitful” way.

item.title: Israel-Gaza: The ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas
item.description: What do we know about the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas, and will it last?

item.title: What's next for BBC after Diana report?
item.description: How will fallout from the the Martin Bashir inquiry affect the BBC's future?

item.title: HMS Queen Elizabeth: Why is a UK aircraft carrier going on a world tour?
item.description: HMS Queen Elizabeth is about to travel 26,000 miles - but is it more than a flag-waving exercise?

item.title: Severely ill - and still made to quarantine in a hotel
item.description: The law says some severely ill are exempt from hotel quarantine - but they don't always get a choice.

item.title: Olivia Rodrigo has become pop's brightest new star - here's how
item.description: She seemingly arrived from nowhere, but the Drivers License singer has been preparing for this all her life.

item.title: WBO orders Joshua to face challenger Usyk
item.description: Anthony Joshua is ordered to defend his WBO heavyweight title against Aleksandr Usyk after the apparent collapse of his Tyson Fury bout.

item.title: Suarez scores winner as Atletico fight back to beat Real to La Liga title - report & highlights
item.description: Atletico Madrid edge city rivals Real Madrid to the La Liga title in dramatic fashion by coming from behind to beat Real Valladolid in the final game.

item.title: 'Whatever he brings I'm ready for' - Taylor bids to unite light-welterweight world titles
item.description: Josh Taylor says he has yet to demonstrate his full potential and believes he will produce a "career-best performance" to vanquish Jose Ramirez.

item.title: Leclerc crash not the only drama around intriguing Monaco
item.description: Charles Leclerc's home pole is refreshing in an already intriguing season - as is Lewis Hamilton's search for answers from his own team.

item.title: 'I don't want to sound arrogant but that was outstanding' - Peaty wins third European gold
item.description: Olympic champion Adam Peaty wins his third European title of the week with 50m breaststroke gold in Budapest.

item.title: St Johnstone beat Hibernian to complete cup double - report & highlights
item.description: St Johnstone edge Hibernian to lift the Scottish Cup for a second time and complete a domestic cup double in the greatest season in the club's history.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Covid: How should I protect myself from Covid now?
item.description: What are the actions we can take to reduce our risk of catching the virus?

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Lockdown restrictions will ease in Northern Ireland, following rule changes in England, Scotland and Wales

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: Restaurants and pubs are reopening inside, but what are the rules?
item.description: Pubs have reopened inside, but there are still Covid rules for customers to follow.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 37 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Lockdown easing: Virus experts tell us what they will (and won't) be doing
item.description: How will scientists use their new-found freedoms when Covid restrictions are eased on Monday?

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People in their 20s and 30s are now being offered a Covid vaccine as the UK rollout continues.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid inquiry: What is it and how will it work?
item.description: An independent public inquiry has been announced, but how will it work?

item.title: Can two households travel in one car? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccines: Why some African states can't use their vaccines
item.description: African countries have struggled to get vaccines, but some now plan to throw away thousands of doses.

item.title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
item.description: B.1.617.2 is dominant in some parts of the country - but it doesn't have to be cause for panic yet.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or face coverings?
item.description: Rules are relaxing, but masks are still needed in some settings - here's where and why.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel in various parts of the UK are being urged to get a Covid test.

item.title: What are the India, Brazil, South Africa and UK variants?
item.description: In some parts of the UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant from India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: Quarantine-free overseas holidays will be possible after 17 May, but what rights do you have if plans or rules change?

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to make hugging safer, from the experts
item.description: Millions of people will be able to hug loved ones again from Monday. But can you minimise the risk?

item.title: India variant: Why was India not put on the red list sooner?
item.description: India was put on the travel ban list two weeks after Pakistan and Bangladesh.

item.title: Indian variant: What's causing the spike in Bolton?
item.description: The town has seen a sharp spike in Covid cases - driven by the emergence of the Indian variant.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid: Who can you hug and meet up with from Monday?
item.description: Guidance on hugging close friends and family is being relaxed in England and Scotland.

item.title: Tom Cruise signed shirts help Woburn football club hit target
item.description: The actor signed the shirts for a local football team after filming at its ground.

item.title: Bee swarm thwarts Colchester gym-goer's journey home
item.description: Justin Stone needed the help of a passer-by to help remove hundreds of bees from his car.

item.title: Penarth RNLI historian wanted for lifeboat station in UK first
item.description: The RNLI is looking for a volunteer to chart the modern history of a lifeboat station.

item.title: Yarn-bombers join M&S and Aldi Colin the Caterpillar cake row
item.description: Knitted versions of Colin and Cuthbert the caterpillar cakes appear on post-boxes.

item.title: The litter-pickers keeping the Clyde bonnie
item.description: Friends of Dumbarton Foreshore share some of its more unusual finds ahead of its first big post-lockdown event.
